vague_description: Optimizing fleet composition for a tourism company balancing capacity, pollution, and customer demand.
detailed_description: A tourism company can buy sedans or buses to add to their fleet of vehicles to increase their capacity for more tourists. A sedan can seat \param{SedanCapacity} tourists per day but results in \param{SedanPollution} units of pollution. A bus can seat \param{BusCapacity} tourists per day but results in \param{BusPollution} units of pollution. The city has limited this tourism company to producing at most \param{MaxPollution} units of pollutants per day. To make a profit, this tourism company must take care of at least \param{MinCustomers} customers per day. Planning to make a profit, how many sedans and how many buses should this tourism company purchase to decrease the total number of vehicles needed?
target_objective: Minimize the total number of vehicles needed to meet customer and pollution constraints
target_constraints: Total pollution from sedans and buses cannot exceed MaxPollution
Total capacity of sedans and buses must be at least MinCustomers
target_parameters: Seating capacity per sedan per day
Seating capacity per bus per day
Maximum allowed pollution units per day
Minimum number of customers to be served per day for profit
